title: How Trump's anti-science policies are impacting French research
summary: The Trump administration launched such an offensive against science and American research that it's almost difficult to imagine the consequences. With research more global than ever, Trump's decisions are having a domino effect: Programs are being suspended and access to common databases is under threat.

title: UNESCO prepares for its next leader in a tense context
summary: Three candidates, all from the Global South, are vying for the leadership of the UN organization, which the US is threatening to leave.

title: PSG survive Aston Villa scare to reach Champions League semi-finals
summary: Paris Saint Germain's lost 3-2 on the night in the second leg, but squeezed through to the semi-finals 5-4 on aggregate.

title: France expels 12 Algerian officials, recalls envoy
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron's office said 12 Algerian officials were expelled on Tuesday in retaliation after Algeria ordered 12 French officials from the interior ministry to leave.

title: Why Syria's tech entrepreneurs are cautiously returning
summary: Even though the situation in the country is far from stable, members of the diaspora are preparing their return, with the idea of investing in the nascent technologies sector.

title: Dior explores sources of inspiration in Japan
summary: Maria Grazia Chiuri unveiled her fall 2025 collection in Kyoto, drawing from a floral universe dear to the fashion house's founder. From a golden kimono to a belted jacket, the silhouettes weave connections between French couture and Japanese craftsmanship.

title: US foreign aid cuts are weakening heritage protection
summary: Budget restrictions imposed by Donald Trump are jeopardizing the preservation of several sites.

title: Sudan, ravaged by two years of civil war, sees conflict spread further
summary: Clashes between the Sudanese Armed Forces and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces have already resulted in over 150,000 deaths in two years. Nearly 13 million people have been displaced, and half of Sudan's 44 million inhabitants are on the brink of famine.

title: Macron tells Netanyahu suffering of Gaza civilians 'must end'
summary: According to a statement released by Netanyahu's office, the Israeli prime minister expressed to the French president his 'strong opposition to the establishment of a Palestinian state, stating that it would be a huge reward for terrorism.'

title: US plans 50% cut to State Department budget, slashing embassies and global programs
summary: The cut would shutter embassies, reduce funding to global organizations like the UN and NATO, and dismantle landmark programs like Fulbright, according to a leaked memo.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu makes rare visit to Gaza
summary: The Israeli prime minister's office said Netanyahu had gone to Gaza on Tuesday, April 15, just under a month after Israel ended its ceasefire with the enclave.

title: Duran Lantink appointed creative director of Jean Paul Gaultier
summary: At 38, the Dutch designer takes the helm of the Parisian house's creative direction. This marks the end of a series of collaborations with guest designers for its haute couture and signals its return to the ready-to-wear calendar.

title: Armenia 'ready' to sign peace agreement with Azerbaijan, but obstacles remain
summary: Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan expressed readiness on Tuesday to initial the historic agreement announced on March 13. Meanwhile, Baku has set new preconditions that may delay the peace between the two former Soviet republics, which have been in conflict for decades.

title: French prisons targeted with torched cars, gunfire attacks: Justice Ministry
summary: Minister of Justice Gérald Darmanin is due to visit the Toulon prison complex in southern France on Tuesday afternoon to offer his support to the officers on site.

title: Lebanon and Syria begin new dialogue
summary: The first visit by members of the new Lebanese government to Syria took place on Monday in Damascus, where an Islamist-led coalition seized power in December 2024.

title: Russia sentences four journalists to prison for 'extremism' over links to Navalny
summary: In a closed-door trial, four reporters were sentenced to 5.5 years each for alleged ties to the late Alexei Navalny's banned anti-corruption foundation.

title: US Democrats look for best path forward amid the 'chaos' of Trump's trade war
summary: The American opposition is searching for the right response to new tariffs, fearing they might appear to defend financial markets or contradict their own past protectionist policies.
